item.title: Jagex's IP
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:55, topic:413897"][quote author=Coelho link=topic=515863.msg3743271#msg3743271 date=1315537506]

… There’ll be things I know about a computer that you don’t …

like what

Everyone knows something that the another doesn’t. There is too much knowledge for one mind to contain. For instance, did you know Command Prompt in Windows isn’t really Command Prompt, but a half arsed version? Now you know.

you just said the command prompt isn’t the command prompt, are you by chance in special education this year?

The regular Command Prompt first created by Windows has been downgraded in later releases of windows. Better worded for you?

do you have any idea what you are going on about?

^You’re not cool so just piss off.

and you belong dead in a ditch so just piss off.
contrary to what your parents told you, you cannot do whatever you set your mind to.

I never said I had an idea of what I was talking about. I said it was a random fact that popped into my head.

Just because someone’s computer knowledge is not plentiful does mean they should “die in a ditch”. If that were the case, My school shouldn’t have even 1% of the people it has now.
[/quote]
fixed.[/quote]
Haven’t you ever heard of those mentally disabled? Heartless bastard.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex's IP
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:38, topic:413897”]And how is it people can connect to our IPs via the command prompt and browse our public folders then, if we can’t do that to a website…

For instance http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/[/quote]

  1. We can’t browse their files? Or are you referring to “My Network Places”
  2. For the moparisthebest example, the webserver (lighttpd) has directory listings turned on, so it sends a simple HTML page with links to every file in the directory. My webserver (nginx) has directory listings turned off, because I can’t be asked to put a “index.html” in every directory I don’t want people to stick their face in that says, “Fuck off”
  3. http://mail.jagex.com/ shows directory listings.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex's IP
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

(Anthony):

have you ever used a computer before in your life?

You see, you’ve got to learn something at least once, and recognising IPs and the difference between computer and internet IPs and how you can use them is one thing I haven’t learnt yet.

I’m more than literate on a computer, so get your head out your arse. There’ll be things I know about a computer that you don’t, that doesn’t mean I’m going to mock you for it.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex's IP
item.dc:creator: @megafone217 megafone217
item.description:
@megafone217 wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:28, topic:413897”]Mendo, I remember a time when I was in your shoes aswell. I’d say get a basic knowledge of computer before learning any language. I’m talking hardware (what does what, and why we need it) and software (how does an OS work in general,…) wise.

You should do some research on how the internet works and what it exactly is.
After you get a general idea of the internet, you should learn about basic networking (server, client,…). If you do all of this, you will have an idea of what an IP is, and what we can do with it.

I’ll explain and IP in short for you. An IP-address, is basicly the address of your internet. Imagine if the internet you pay for was a house, then it would have an address. That address would be the IP-address. When you visit a website, play a server, the owner can see your IP-address.
When you open a server, for people to play on, or a website, they have to type in the adress of your internet, in order to connect to your internet for playing on that server you opened. Try putting Jagex’ IP in your browser, it will open their website. It’s just the address, so that your computer knows wich “house” to visit for getting data.

When you know the adress of a house, you’re pretty much nothing with the address alone, because you can’t just break into the house with knowing the address only. Having the key of that address on the other hand, would mean something else.

That key could be anything really, for example, it could be information about an FTP server for that IP address, wich gives you access to for example the website files of the HTTP server. Yes both of those are servers like RSPS servers. FTP runs most of the time on port 21 and HTTP on port 80.

Imagine the internet being all the houses and stuff, and the guys making sure that everything is connected with eachother so that one IP can connect to another for viewing websites, playing online games are the streets and the planet where all the houses are build on. But imagine a planet that has an infinite surface, one that expands when a new house is built.

And that my friend, is called, THE INTERWEBS![/quote]

thank you for this detailed explaination i now know how to internet thank you shalom

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex's IP
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:38, topic:413897”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=515863.msg3742619#msg3742619 date=1315499960]
Mendo, I remember a time when I was in your shoes aswell. I’d say get a basic knowledge of computer before learning any language. I’m talking hardware (what does what, and why we need it) and software (how does an OS work in general,…) wise.

You should do some research on how the internet works and what it exactly is.
After you get a general idea of the internet, you should learn about basic networking (server, client,…). If you do all of this, you will have an idea of what an IP is, and what we can do with it.

I’ll explain and IP in short for you. An IP-address, is basicly the address of your internet. Imagine if the internet you pay for was a house, then it would have an address. That address would be the IP-address. When you visit a website, play a server, the owner can see your IP-address.
When you open a server, for people to play on, or a website, they have to type in the adress of your internet, in order to connect to your internet for playing on that server you opened. Try putting Jagex’ IP in your browser, it will open their website. It’s just the address, so that your computer knows wich “house” to visit for getting data.

When you know the adress of a house, you’re pretty much nothing with the address alone, because you can’t just break into the house with knowing the address only. Having the key of that address on the other hand, would mean something else.

That key could be anything really, for example, it could be information about an FTP server for that IP address, wich gives you access to for example the website files of the HTTP server. Yes both of those are servers like RSPS servers. FTP runs most of the time on port 21 and HTTP on port 80.

Imagine the internet being all the houses and stuff, and the guys making sure that everything is connected with eachother so that one IP can connect to another for viewing websites, playing online games are the streets and the planet where all the houses are build on. But imagine a planet that has an infinite surface, one that expands when a new house is built.

And that my friend, is called, THE INTERWEBS!
[/quote]
Thanks for the effort you put into that.

Maybe I should of explained in the post before people thought I wanted to know if I could “hack” Jagex. What I really pictured was people connecting to the server ripping ID lists using a program to extract it from the server or some sort… I don’t know that’s how I always imagined it, but now I think about it that’s just done from the cache?

And how is it people can connect to our IPs via the command prompt and browse our public folders then, if we can’t do that to a website…

For instance http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/[/quote]

have you ever used a computer before in your life?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:28, topic:413897”]Mendo, I remember a time when I was in your shoes aswell. I’d say get a basic knowledge of computer before learning any language. I’m talking hardware (what does what, and why we need it) and software (how does an OS work in general,…) wise.

You should do some research on how the internet works and what it exactly is.
After you get a general idea of the internet, you should learn about basic networking (server, client,…). If you do all of this, you will have an idea of what an IP is, and what we can do with it.

I’ll explain and IP in short for you. An IP-address, is basicly the address of your internet. Imagine if the internet you pay for was a house, then it would have an address. That address would be the IP-address. When you visit a website, play a server, the owner can see your IP-address.
When you open a server, for people to play on, or a website, they have to type in the adress of your internet, in order to connect to your internet for playing on that server you opened. Try putting Jagex’ IP in your browser, it will open their website. It’s just the address, so that your computer knows wich “house” to visit for getting data.

When you know the adress of a house, you’re pretty much nothing with the address alone, because you can’t just break into the house with knowing the address only. Having the key of that address on the other hand, would mean something else.

That key could be anything really, for example, it could be information about an FTP server for that IP address, wich gives you access to for example the website files of the HTTP server. Yes both of those are servers like RSPS servers. FTP runs most of the time on port 21 and HTTP on port 80.

Imagine the internet being all the houses and stuff, and the guys making sure that everything is connected with eachother so that one IP can connect to another for viewing websites, playing online games are the streets and the planet where all the houses are build on. But imagine a planet that has an infinite surface, one that expands when a new house is built.

And that my friend, is called, THE INTERWEBS![/quote]
Thanks for the effort you put into that.

Maybe I should of explained in the post before people thought I wanted to know if I could “hack” Jagex. What I really pictured was people connecting to the server ripping ID lists using a program to extract it from the server or some sort… I don’t know that’s how I always imagined it, but now I think about it that’s just done from the cache?

And how is it people can connect to our IPs via the command prompt and browse our public folders then, if we can’t do that to a website…

For instance http://www.moparisthebest.com/rs/

Read full topic
